item.title: Report X-2023111189
item.description:
Report X-2023111189

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat packages were stacked as part of a wall of packages and were not in the proper place , towards the end of the trailer. When the door was opened the , the wall of packages fell over and the hazmats were damaged and leaked at the caps. Approx 1 gal spilled and soiled the entire package DescribePack: lids DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in bin for inspection

item.title: Report X-2023111179
item.description:
Report X-2023111179

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, the caps were found loose allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023111102
item.description:
Report X-2023111102

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: came out of the semi truck damaged DescribePack: The package was soaked from the inside out due to the internal of the packaging not having any structures to help prevent the damages. Glass bottles had to much room to move around inside the packaging DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from the trailer and put into a red hazmat bin and then taken to the QA area to be processed.

DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS VENTED WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS PLACED RIGHT SIDE UP TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE

item.description:
Report X-2023111027

  • State: OH

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE M2 BOXLINE FOR A LEAKER. BOX WITH OXIDIXER HAZARDOUS MATERIALS LABEL WAS FOUND WET ON THE SLIDE. USING THE DECISION TREE, OXIDIZER RESPONSE SHEET AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2023110672
item.description:
Report X-2023110672

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was tipped on side allowing the loose cap to leak inside. Loader noticed the wet package and alerted QA. In house clean up. Placed in salvage drum and sealed. DescribePack: Cap inside was loose inside and started leaking when tipped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fiberboard absorbed the liquid. In house clean up. Placed in salvage drum awaiting disposition from pgh.

item.title: Report X-2023120008
item.description:
Report X-2023120008

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: MIAMISBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was taken off the trailer is came in on. It was discovered to be visibly wet. With the hazmat markings, it was understood to be careful with the package. Someone with gloves put the hazmat in the damaged bucket and notified QA of the damaged hazmat. DescribePack: I believe the failure was the inner packaging, or lack thereof. The containers were inside a garbage bag inside the box. I don't think the garbage bag protected the containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed into a black damaged package bucket and resulted in no spillage on the floor and only spillage in the bucket

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents, one of the containers was cracked due to being dropped during processing causing spillage. DescribePack: Cracked body/container. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023110332
item.description:
Report E-2023110332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: Brewster
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1100 hrs. on 10-23-2023, the WLE Brewster Yardmaster called myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. He told me the Brewster Yard Car Inspectors could smell an odor from tank car CPDX 111023. I came out to look at the car and used a gas detection meter on the protective house and confirmed that this car was leaking. I removed cable seal #1756092 and opened the protective housing to find that the A end liquid valve was frosted over and leaking. I checked the valve handle to find that it was loose. The valve was leaking through the valve plug threads. I tightened the valve and the leak stopped. It took about an 1/8 of a turn to stop the leak. I then tightened the valve plug. I reinstalled cable seal 0000235 on the protective housing and then released the car for service.

item.title: Report I-2023090151
item.description:
Report I-2023090151

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: DELAWARE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was unloading the product into the customer's tank while a customer's employee was monitoring the gauge on the tank(because the gauge was not visible from the truck). The customer's employee switched the valve to unload into a different tank when the first tank was full and another employee switched the valve back causing 150 gallons to overflow from the tank into containment. The overflow lasted approximately 45 seconds.
